intro: Guenthera repanda subsp. saxatilis, commonly known as the rock guenthera, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. This subspecies is typically found growing in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to withstand drought conditions. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging soils.
